title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 165.7 - Skinning
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 165.7 - Skinning

State Regulations
(a) The following
definitions provide a basis for describing lots of potatoes as to the degree of
skinning whenever description may be appropriate: (1)

Practically no skinning means that not
more than five percent of the potatoes in the lot have more than one-tenth of
the skin missing or feathered; (2)

Slightly skinned means that not more than 10 percent of the potatoes in the lot
have more than one-fourth of the skin missing or feathered; (3)

Moderately skinned means that not more
than 10 percent of the potatoes in the lot have more than one-half of the skin
missing or feathered; and
(4)

Badly
skinned means that more than 10 percent of the potatoes in the lot have more
than one-half of the skin missing or feathered. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
165.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
